ry 7, 2014
												The Ship is a combination of Assassin's Creed Multiplayer and The Sims. You need to hunt down and kill your given target, all the while not getting detected, or killed by another player and at the same time tend to your needs. This game can be pretty tense as you only have so much time to kill your target. You also need to bag as much money as possible; so you need to search for high money weapons. The amount of money you get for killing someone with a certain weapon varies. Some areas of a map are under surveillance so if you get caught you lose money, all your weapons and opportunities to kill your target. Other people will be out to get you too so keep watch, otherwise you lose everything in your inventory. Tending to your needs can be difficult as well; as you will spend a lot of time trying to find and kill your target. All of these gameplay mechanics make the game fairly tricky, but it is a good challenge and a very enjoyable game that I highly recommend.

												Everything else is boring to you?Then play this, it's awkward and yet it's fun. The stalker simulator you've been waiting for.You can roleplay too!Here's what I did for lolz:- Sat on stairway with knife out, slicing passerby. People fled for their lives even though they weren't my targets.- Stalked random individuals, crouching, pretending I'm looking at others but following them, eventually they panic and the reactions are hilarious specially if their hunter kills them and you are not even involved.- Hunting, killing random ship mates is still a better love story than twilight.- Setting traps, and watching people try pick them up and go to space.- Stalking a person and pushing it into a room, then closing the door. They always panic and pull out a gun or melee weapon, all you have to do is run out (assuming you survive) and they'll get arrested, pull out a weapon and join them in jail then find a shank and stare at them for a while, pull out the shank and have fun.This game is surely best with friends. The only thing it lacks is direct and global voice chat which I hope new devs will implement. The server browser is cumbersome (read community hub) but it works.Worth a buy, specially on sale as the game drops cards which quickly redeem the game in worth anyway.

er 25, 2013
												Source mod gone full retail. The Ship is a great premise: Find your target among the people on a cruise ship and take them out, while someone else is doing the same to hunt you down. Throw in a Sims style needs system so players can't camp, a weapon bounty system so players need to try out new weapons, and a lovely 1920's style atmosphere, and you *should* have a great game. However, The Ship does show many problems, mostly when compared to it's mod predecessor. In the mod, there would be many civilians to confuse and work around to get to your target. In The Ship, you rarely see more than one or two civilians in total on these large cruise ships. Because of this, many games just turn into a deathmatch rather than a complex game of stalking and decieving. You can turn up the amount of civvies, but there's still a very small limit on that, and rarely multiplayer servers turn this config on.The Ship is also very dated. The game hasn't been updated in many years, and the controls show it. Even once you get past that, there's still some very strange workarounds you can find on the levels. It just feels old, rather than classic or "old school". What's worse, the previous devs have been absorbed into Ubisoft, and the current publisher for The Ship, Blazing Griffin, can't secure the rights to modifiy the game's code (even after a failed Kickstarter campaign), so it's stuck like this for the forseeable future.If you can gather together a group of friends who all understand the little things and problems with The Ship, you can enjoy it for a while, but it won't last forever. Grab it if it's on sale.

2, 2012
												The Ship: Murder Party is a first person shooter computer game using Valve Software's Source engine developed by Outerlight. The game was released on July 11, 2006, on Steam with retail distribution in Europe and Australia in September, and April 10, 2007, for North America.[4] A playable concept for The Ship was released as a modification for the game Half-Life in 2004.The game is set on a 1920s recreational cruise ship. Each player is assigned a quarry, and the object is to murder him or her with nobody watching, while at the same time watching out for, and defending yourself against, your own hunter.Story:A mysterious man named Mr. X has handed out free tickets for his luxury cruise. Little did the passengers know they were falling into his devious trap. All the passengers are required to track down and murder another passenger. If a passenger chooses not to do so, Mr. X will kill him or her.Would buy again 10/1920x1080

er 27, 2011
												"The Ship" Singleplayer was an adventure were you have to complete a series of tasks to complete the certain missions people in the game gave you. The missions range from sneaking around to killing people like a hit list. The graphics and style of gameplay are very smooth and well done. The overall Singleplayer's goal is to stop the captain of the ship and win his game. You can interact with a wide variety of things on the ship. You have a variety of ways to kill your enemies or targets. The game has alot of humor and is a pure enjoyment. The online portion has bots in it which makes it fun but there is a small community to play with were actual human players play. The overall game is well done and fun to play in short segments. I have enjoyed this little diamond in the rough and I know you will too if you like First Person Shooters with a little class.

It's a lot of fun to mess around on the huge ship, blasting the guards, destroying all of the food, and even robbing the bank. Instead of killing my target, I just bring up the map, find the parts of the ship you're not supposed to be in, and shoot all the crew to loot the place before placing my secret stash of weapons under some dude's bed.

												The game is very simple and entertaining.More fun when playing multiplayer with others also fun when playing alone.I get the problem of many that you cannot access servers from the main game. I know many people have already found solutions to this and it is very simple but a bit annoying. When switching between tabs and all.All in all the game is fun, everybody gets a query to kill one another and you can find weapons all around the ship from cupbaords, drawers, on the wall etc.. You are not allowed to kill your query in front of guards or staff personnel and you should try to remain non suspicious the whole time or else others can kill you. At the same time you have things to keep updating yourself through out the game such as your food intake, bladder, sleep, shower, reading a book etc...Maybe the bad part I would say or not very bad but it kinda finishes the game quickly is one thing. You can know where your query is, it will say on the right hand side where your query was the last time which makes the game finish quickly.All in all ITS FUN, it is a calmer version of Gary's Mod murder where everybody is a killer to another. I totally recommend it specially it is very cheap.

er 9, 2015
												Fun little game, with a cartoonish feel about it.The game is pretty simple, you must murder your target, and preferably in a very unbecoming manner (to gain extra points) without being caught.Secondly you yourself are a target, so you'll have to watch your back, while trying to assassinate your target.Most of the game takes place on a ship, hence the name, but one or two maps are based on a small island.Gameplay is pretty good, and if you have a couple of friends, who feels like playing the game with you, it instantly turns into a lot of fun.You can choose to play against bots, bots and humans, or only humans.Getting away with murder, or just assault, isn't that easy, as you'll have to be aware of cameras, security and "forbidden" areas.All of this makes for a fun game, which is a lot more fun, when playing with or against a group of friends.

content:
r 26, 2015
												A hidden gem in the Steam Store, this game is sure to make your friends rage and also requires detective skills. This is basically The Sims with murder in it. You have a target or "the quarry" to kill, but the trick is that another person is hunting you down called your "hunter". The goal is to get as much money as you can from using the weapons and each weapon is randomly generated per a round a "MFK" or Money For Kill (ex. a revolver gives $3213 money for each kill or next round the same revolver only gets $2153). This game is hella fun to play with your friends but sadly none of my friends have this game, or they do, but never play it. Not only you have to hunt down your quarry, you also have to take care of yourself. There's food, beds, showers, etc. You need to take care by keeping cleaning, nourished, and also going to the bathroom, just like I said before the Sims. And, you dont need to worry about your identity, your given a random gender, name, and appearance every time you die. There is a variety of maps and weapons. I'd have to say, this game was sitting in my library, until I got bored and let me tell you it was a great decision I made. The game is really cheap ($5 I think? not sure didnt checked). Please. Grab this game, especially in 2-pack form so you can give an extra copy to your friends.

Product received for free
												The Ship is a game where you hunt other people while being hunted yourself.Ever played Assassin's Creed's Hunt mode or Trouble in Terrorist Town? This is very similar.The main difference between The Ship and those games is its Sims-like needs system.This concept may be foreign to people unfamiliar with The Ship, but eating and drinking are essential to not dying.Too hungry? You die.Too thirsty? You die.Too tired? You fall asleep and somebody literally stabs you in the back.Managing one's needs is a way The Ship forces players into the open.Just skip the Single Player game, it's agonizingly slow and boring.

8, 2016
Product received for free
												Intellectually created with wonderful gameplay, the ship offers a truly unique experience which encompasses a wide variety of factors.Being a murderer on a boat stranded in the ocean with a load of other murderers has never been so entertaining as in this clever strategy game. Plan out an assassination and locate your target on one of several ellaborate cruise liners. With a extreme variety of methods to kill your victims ranging from flare guns to prosthetic arms, The ship entertains in forms of humour and  suspense.The ship has strategy in the execution of a murder to the planning of the rest of your time. As food, sleep, and hygiene are all in game components to prevent you from dying or being unhealthy. Fun for single players or large groups looking for a murder mystery multiplayer game.The only real place where the game could improve is that the nudity isn't as graphic as it could be. When I play this game I viciously masturbate in order to get the most out of it, but it's difficult to get my ♥♥♥♥ to maximum hardness when the nudity isn't as prominent. But for a game with excellent market value for how good of a game it is, you don't have to go any further than The Ship.

y 17, 2016
 DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine If you love going on cruises then this cruise is not for you. It is going to get dangerous and bloody...The Ship: Murder Party is a game I have been playing since its inception. Its only recently I have decided to buy it on Steam and keep it as my own and boy has time surely caught on...The Ship's objective is that you are a passenger on a cruise ship owned by Mr. X, your objective is to kill a random passenger you have been assigned to but a hunter is hunting you down too. Its a simple game but can be really fun to play alone or with your friendsThe game has shown its age and even now the game's menus don't work properly so much so that you have to take the long way round and play the multiplayer aspect differently. Thankfully people do still play this game however only at peak times do you find a lot of players playing the gameThe Ship does also offer a seperate tutorial and single player. The tutorial basically shows you the basics on how the game works and the single player offers you a story while showing the game's mechanics in action. For me, the single player is nothing special, even for new players, the single player is nothing special and could only be used to see how the mechanics work for a whileThe Ship: Murder Party has always been by my heart and I appreciate that a company like Blazing Griffin has taken the rights from the now defunct Outerlight and continued to perfect the gameThe big choice is whether you should get it. For players like me who remember playing this game back when it first came out, I'd say yes, just for the nostalgia, however for new players, I'd sadly say no, its too old and now the new owners of The Ship are making a remastered version of the old game so its best to wait for the remastered versionBut, its one hell of a bloody good time! RECOMMENDED :)  THEPCGAMER'S BEST GAME IN STEAM LIBRARY! (What's this? :- Like some games get "Best Game of 2014" or "Best Indie Game", etc... So I have decided to make my own!)

28, 2015
												Grab a few friends, join each other in a single room (screens facing away) and just go to town with this game. It is so much fun being certain you're safe only to be gunned down by someone you never suspected was following you. Sneaking around in paranoia because one of your friends is being -too- quiet only to be taken down by a useless NPC causes both rage and laughter. I can't recommend this game enough if you have friends to play with it. The single player is pretty dull but at it's heart The Ship is a multiplayer game. Unfortunately the few servers which still seem to be played online are full of people who enjoy kicking people for no reason but I have spent 95% of my time playing this with friends and I'm sure I will keep coming back to it time and time again.

												I had wayyyy to much fun playing this.If you have a friend, it's great to fire up a server with bots, or join a regular server on your own. This has got to be one of the best games of its kind. You randomly will recieve a person you will have to kill before time runs out, if you fail, nothing happens, if you kill them you'll get money based on the weapon you use. However, you have to be extremely careful to not get noticed by a guard, or security camera.That would be too simple though! You have to be careful to more than just good guys, there's someone out to kill you as well! You're randomly selected to be someones target as well, and you'll never find out who until they attempt to kill you (or if they tell you, but what's the fun in that?).It's a great suspense and strategy game, trying to avoid being killed or seen, while still having to get your target away from the crowds.I would highly recommend this to basically anyone!

y 16, 2015
												Great fun, alone or with friend/s, and comes with two more versions of itself than necessary. It's basically first-person Cluedo, but everyone is the murderer. And that not only means that you have to hunt down and kill your quarry in the set time, but you yourself may be hunted, sometimes by more than one player. There is a constant barrage of needs that you must fulfill over the rounds you play, much like in the Sims, to avoid death and forfeiting aforesaid rounds. There is also a money/points system set up for best weapon kill, which rotates each round, to keep things interesting. Still surprising myself with the many sneaky ways you can go about hunting and finding out who's hunting you.

y 26, 2015
												The Ship is, for the most part, a good game. It's fun with friends and offers an interesting dynamic where you never know who your being hunted by or who you can trust. The game is especially fun with friends. The game has interesting weapons, some compelling mechanics such as disguises and surveillance officers. The game runs on the premise that everyone is a hunter and everyone is being hunted. You have only so long to kill your quarry after the first murderer on the server kills theirs. You can then steal some items off their corpse and even off innocent people you may have killed along the way. The art style is somewhat appealing, and has an almost TF2 look about it. Most of the maps are fun and gratifying to explore and some of the weapons like the poison in a syringe is just damn fun to use. The needs system is for the most part unique and interesting and gives killing your quarry an extra layer of difficulty.But...The game has a fair amount of flaws that make it unenjoyable in some spots. The game has a strict "Kill Quarry Only" policy that makes it hard to just screw around and have fun with friends, since, if you kill too many innocent people, you are (indefinitely in some cases) banned from the server. Some of the maps are way too damn big, or are just straight up horrible to play on. The needs, while there for the soul purpose of making your life difficult, are ridiculous sometimes. For instance, why in the hell, when I'm about to kill my quarry, should my character stop everything he's doing and go, "Nope. No way am I killing this guy, until I've read me some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Shakespeare." The Single Player and Tutorial versions that are treated like entirely separate games, are essentially pointless because the game just isn't fun without friends. And don't worry. The game has made it a priority to make it as frustrating and unnecessarily difficult as possible for you to connect with your friends and play the game properly. The in-game server list does not work. You MUST use the one accessed through the Options menu or you can't play with friends.All in all I do recommend this game, but only if you have friends to play it with.

												Grab a few friends, join each other in a single room (screens facing away) and just go to town with this game. It is so much fun being certain you're safe only to be gunned down by someone you never suspected was following you. Sneaking around in paranoia because one of your friends is being -too- quiet only to be taken down by a useless NPC causes both rage and laughter. I can't recommend this game enough if you have friends to play with it. The single player is pretty dull but at it's heart The Ship is a multiplayer game. Unfortunately the few servers which still seem to be played online are full of people who enjoy kicking people for no reason but I have spent 95% of my time playing this with friends and I'm sure I will keep coming back to it time and time again.

												This game is very(and I mean very ) worth it. The single player is nice when you want to enjoy a simple plot line. The game explains very well what you need to do and how you need to do it. In the beginning of the game you will probably feel invincible because it seems that no one is hunting you. You don't need to watch your back and you can actually enjoy doing some activities. As the game progresses, the npcs start hunting you. Now eating, peeing, and bathing starts to get a bit difficult and you become paranoid. Luckily, the single player campaign(or mode) is a short game, therefore, there is no need to worry.The multiplayer is very fun. In the multiplayer you can't be as relaxed as in the singleplayer. You got to get the supplies you need quickly or it may be to late, depending on who you are player with. So in the end, I think you should just get the game.

												The Ship shows just how important it is to carefully design every aspect of your game. Everything from the weapons to the maps is designed to be simple and easily accessible while still rewarding players with an attention to detail.The Ship is a great game for people who don't much care for multiplayer FPS games and instead want something a little more 'clever'.However, a word of warning. There are not a lot of servers for The Ship and, at the time of writing this, the Server Browser doesn't really work. So, I recommend you look up some servers on the internet, then add the IP addresses to your favorites to easily access the servers. Even if you don't live in the countries where these servers are located, don't worry. The Ship is surprisingly forgiving when it comes to latency. 200-250 ping is usually good enough for you to kill your way to the top 3.Once you get past all that, you're looking at one of the most well designed multiplayer experiences ever made. If you've taken a brief look, and you like what you see, get it. It is well worth the money.

4, 2015
												Really fun game with quite interesting mechanics. You are trapped on a Ship along with other Players, having to murder each other to win the competition. Each player is assigned to the other in a pair. A Hunter and the Hunted. A Hunter is trying to find and kill the Hunted one, while the Hunted one is most likely a Hunter to someone else and tries to find them and kill them.So basically you really need to watch your back, as anyone might try to plot to kill you, perhaps waiting for the moment when you go to sleep... Yes, sleep. In the game you have to sustain your character's needs via sleep, eating, drinking, talking and reading books/entertaining. Think of it as The Sims with a twisted plot where characters must kill each other off.Also... Killing people won't win you the game. Killing them in the most paying way will earn you the victory. Each kill is awarding amount of money based on the weapon you use to kill someone (unless you use environment, like the Freezer/Life-Boats.)Amazing game, fun to play 1v1, but it is recommended to play on the server with other players. You can also play alone against bots. They sometimes can surprise you, but most of the time they are slightly disappointing.10/10 - Recommended.

												Murder your friends.The servers are no longer supported so you have to search for open servers outside of the game (and there's only 3 maybe).The game is played with a number of bots to fill the boat with "people-who-aren't-your-target". You're given a target to go murder discretely (or at least not on camera or in front of guards) while at the same time you're looking over your shoulder for your hunter. You also have "The Sims"-like needs to manage at the same time.It's an interesting extension from its Half-Life 1 mod and makes for a really fun game to play with friends. Because you never know if your pal is going to be shanking you in a few seconds.

y 4, 2015
												When I first saw this game I saved it to my wishlist to come take a closer look at it again. I picked it up for half off on sale because it looked like a quirky game with interesting PvP mechanics, what I hadn't noticed is that the game was actually from 2006.The Ship is very fun and exciting starting out and discovering all of her quirks. But after coming back for a few days playing a few matches it lost the momentum, I've mostly stopped returning. I would however have a lot more fun If I got together with some mates and played together as the game can get high-strung and hilarious. Cons- First off, you can no longer acess servers directly in-game. You have to look them up in steams view --> servers --> filter/The Ship.- The text in each corner showing you where you and your mark are can get greally difficult to read, especially because the colors often match the enviroment.- There's no point in ulitlizing the shops and pulling out cash because there are stored outfits and weapons everywhere.- Hallways and doorthresholds can often create impasses as characters cannot get around each other, and your stuck fidgeting for a hole minute or some jackass won't let you leave the room.- The UI wasn't well planned, as I'm learning the map I'm tired of having to look in the top corner, then all the way to the bottom and then center again, it's tiring.Pros+ The gameplay is unique+ Good mark payout system+ Gameplay is generally fun, and exciting.+ Several different maps to learn+ An additional needs system (although most are easily taken care of if you're arrested+ Sense of satisfaction when finding your mark, or pre-emptivly killing who was supposed to kill you.

												I bought The Ship: The Murder Party while it was on sale ($2.49) is definitely worth it because it is a great game. It's great with parties and making a server really isn't that hard. Many servers are also available on websites. It's just upsetting that the master server(s) aren't working anymore. Due to that fact, it shouldn't really be worth $9.99 unless that problem is fixed. The AIs are super fishy and creepy, so it is always better to play multiplayer. I also like how the game relates to "Sims" in a way (bathroom, hunger, etc.) but I feel like that "Sims" feel isn't making much of a difference in the game since it doesn't really add very much difficulty to the game. Besides the few flaws of this game, it is definitely worth to buy, but not with the original price until the servers are fixed.

												Murder your friends.The servers are no longer supported so you have to search for open servers outside of the game (and there's only 3 maybe).The game is played with a number of bots to fill the boat with "people-who-aren't-your-target". You're given a target to go murder discretely (or at least not on camera or in front of guards) while at the same time you're looking over your shoulder for your hunter. You also have "The Sims"-like needs to manage at the same time.It's an interesting extension from its Half-Life 1 mod and makes for a really fun game to play with friends. Because you never know if your pal is going to be shanking you in a few seconds.

												I am very satisfied with the gameplay. If you like assasination and murder games, this is for you! Try and kill your quarry, but don't get caught! Also be careful your quarry doesn't kill you before you kill them. Don't kill anyone else but them, but remember, you're being hunted too! The only people you can kill besides your target are random noobs that attack you for absolutely no reason, and your hunter. This game is also hilarious when it comes to killing with all the interesting weapons! Whoever gains the most money in the end wins the hunt. But besides hunting, you have to take care of yourself too. You're only human. Eat, drink, bathe, entertain yourself, and do pretty much everything you would need to do in real life. It's like a combination of The Sims and murder games. Also, with your purchase you get TWO extra gifts to send to your Steam friends! Also, each friend who gets it will get yet another gift to send, but only one, not two. This game spreads like a plague! :P10/10Example of how this game gives you a smashin' good time from my own experience: I set fire to a man and finished him with an axe. While he was peeing.

14, 2012
												A brilliant, stylised murder mystery simulator; where you take the role of one of a group of hunters all out to kill one another or a witness enjoying their cruise. Gameplay is split between stealth, murdering people and tending to your needs - think of Cludeo crossed with the Sims - and its all wrapped up in a variety of 1950s nautical settings. For a source mod released in 2006, the game boasts an impressive amount of multiplayer gameplay types, an arcade mode with just bots and a single player campaign with tutorials.If you’re weighing up whether the game is worth it and considering buying it with some friends, it should be mentioned that you receive two extra passes for the game, gifting of which will each give another pass; effectively giving five copies for the price shown on the store page.

y 4, 2015
												When I first saw this game I saved it to my wishlist to come take a closer look at it again. I picked it up for half off on sale because it looked like a quirky game with interesting PvP mechanics, what I hadn't noticed is that the game was actually from 2006.The Ship is very fun and exciting starting out and discovering all of her quirks. But after coming back for a few days playing a few matches it lost the momentum, I've mostly stopped returning. I would however have a lot more fun If I got together with some mates and played together as the game can get high-strung and hilarious. Cons- First off, you can no longer acess servers directly in-game. You have to look them up in steams view --> servers --> filter/The Ship.- The text in each corner showing you where you and your mark are can get greally difficult to read, especially because the colors often match the enviroment.- There's no point in ulitlizing the shops and pulling out cash because there are stored outfits and weapons everywhere.- Hallways and doorthresholds can often create impasses as characters cannot get around each other, and your stuck fidgeting for a hole minute or some jackass won't let you leave the room.- The UI wasn't well planned, as I'm learning the map I'm tired of having to look in the top corner, then all the way to the bottom and then center again, it's tiring.Pros+ The gameplay is unique+ Good mark payout system+ Gameplay is generally fun, and exciting.+ Several different maps to learn+ An additional needs system (although most are easily taken care of if you're arrested+ Sense of satisfaction when finding your mark, or pre-emptivly killing who was supposed to kill you.

ry 2, 2014
												The Ship shows just how important it is to carefully design every aspect of your game. Everything from the weapons to the maps is designed to be simple and easily accessible while still rewarding players with an attention to detail.The Ship is a great game for people who don't much care for multiplayer FPS games and instead want something a little more 'clever'.However, a word of warning. There are not a lot of servers for The Ship and, at the time of writing this, the Server Browser doesn't really work. So, I recommend you look up some servers on the internet, then add the IP addresses to your favorites to easily access the servers. Even if you don't live in the countries where these servers are located, don't worry. The Ship is surprisingly forgiving when it comes to latency. 200-250 ping is usually good enough for you to kill your way to the top 3.Once you get past all that, you're looking at one of the most well designed multiplayer experiences ever made. If you've taken a brief look, and you like what you see, get it. It is well worth the money.

ry 7, 2014
												The Ship is a combination of Assassin's Creed Multiplayer and The Sims. You need to hunt down and kill your given target, all the while not getting detected, or killed by another player and at the same time tend to your needs. This game can be pretty tense as you only have so much time to kill your target. You also need to bag as much money as possible; so you need to search for high money weapons. The amount of money you get for killing someone with a certain weapon varies. Some areas of a map are under surveillance so if you get caught you lose money, all your weapons and opportunities to kill your target. Other people will be out to get you too so keep watch, otherwise you lose everything in your inventory. Tending to your needs can be difficult as well; as you will spend a lot of time trying to find and kill your target. All of these gameplay mechanics make the game fairly tricky, but it is a good challenge and a very enjoyable game that I highly recommend.

												I bought this a while ago through the "Ship Compete Pack" and was pleasently suprised that it came with extra copies. The real fun comes when you play The Ship against Bots, or better yet your friends in LAN Connectionthen the error came (and apparently im unique in this complaint)For some reason or another it decided that it doesnt even like THINKING about multiplayer, and will crash HARD whenever I tried to do so. So naturally I contacted publisher with a generic "WTF" email. The publisher took 3 weeks and only said words to the effect of "No clue whats going on, talk to steam". Then i contacted steam and was promptly advised to contact the publisherEven after uninstalling it, reinstalling it, CCcleaning it, reinstalling it 5 total times... it has yet to fix the crippling bugSo while the game provides unending fun in both bot mode and multiplayer mode, the issue i experienced (and its decided lack of help) makes me regretfully unable to reccomend this game

												Catching the game in Halloween sale, this is definitely an unexpectedly well made game.Starting with a solid tutorial, an interesting singleplayer and of course, the multiplayer that is quite entertaining with at least one or two friends playing with you.Last point is very easily achieved because with every purchase you get two additional copies of the game ready to be gifted to friends. Once activated by them, they also get one copy to share...So basically you pay less than 5€ for the game itself. And it's definitely worth it!The names you get, the persons, how they look, what you can use as a weapon and all the funny moments (watch the kinda epic trailer) make the game pretty damn solid.The bots can be configured to play with you, although they are quite stupid. But watching them getting caught by the officers trying to commit a murder is somehow entertaining.But there is one major drawback after all: Too few people are playing it!After all, you are not dependant on the developers to play the game in multiplayer, so catch it when it is on sale or share the price with your friends... Recommended!

er 5, 2013
												A really interesting and under-appreciated experience. I've been playing this game intermittently for 7 years and it still feels a fresh and original experience.The game is first-person built on the little dated but reliable Source engine. To win you must earn a certain amount of money. Cash can be used to buy food, items, healing etc and to earn it you must find, identify and covertly kill your assigned target while ensuring that you are not yourself killed by the anonymous player assigned to hunt you. More interesting and unique methods of assassination earn you a greater reward. If you are killed by your hunter you will be out of the round and you will be unable to earn anything until the next round.While doing all this you have to maintain your basic human needs; eating, drinking, sleeping, washing etc which if neglected will disable you and bring about your early demise. This clever little mechanic ensure you can't just camp in a safe place and wait out a battle, and gives your hunter the opportunity to catch you unawares. You must kill your target covertly; if you are witnessed brandishing a weapon either by security, cameras or multiple witnesses you have your weapons confiscate, be put into prison for a set amount of time, and fined a heavy penalty. Not only does this delay the elimination of your target, it also leaves you in a very vulnerable situation to whoever is hunting you. The art and level design add significantly to the experience. Set on a variety of 1920's era cruise ships the art style is stylish, lighthearted and a little slapstick.  The level design is fantastic; each map has all kinds of secret locations, stashes and traps that make them a joy to explore. Even after playing for many years I still discover new exciting details. One thing to remember is that this game is meant to be enjoyed as a multiplayer experience. While the AI passengers can sometimes catch you out, and are suitable for practice, it's broadly speaking pretty dumb and doesn't offer much of a challenge. The AI is most useful for padding out the number of passengers on a cruise, making identification and execution of your human target more of a challenge, indeed doing your best to imitate the sometimes strange behavior of the AI can be an excellent technique to lure you target into a false sense of security.There are only really two criticism I can make of this game; The first is a little unfair given its age but worth mentioning. There is a limited population in the online servers which can make finding an enjoyable populated game a little difficult. Luckily buying the game contains 2 additional copies free which gives you some copies to share with friends which is a pretty good deal. Especially considering there is no joy quite like hearing the frustration of a good friend when you catch them out and brutally eliminate their avatar. Secondly the learning curve can be a little steep. However I believe there are a single player and tutorial package included now although I have yet to try them. On the other hand its pretty easy to pick up with playing with a friendly experience player.  tl;dr a unique multi-player assassination experience that is still worth the asking price despite its age. Best shared with friends.

												I had wayyyy to much fun playing this.If you have a friend, it's great to fire up a server with bots, or join a regular server on your own. This has got to be one of the best games of its kind. You randomly will recieve a person you will have to kill before time runs out, if you fail, nothing happens, if you kill them you'll get money based on the weapon you use. However, you have to be extremely careful to not get noticed by a guard, or security camera.That would be too simple though! You have to be careful to more than just good guys, there's someone out to kill you as well! You're randomly selected to be someones target as well, and you'll never find out who until they attempt to kill you (or if they tell you, but what's the fun in that?).It's a great suspense and strategy game, trying to avoid being killed or seen, while still having to get your target away from the crowds.I would highly recommend this to basically anyone!

												I've never read anything by Agatha Cristie but I've seen plenty of Poriot on Masterpiece Theater so I know what I'm talking about here: This is a pretty fun game but annoying. Matches on average last about thirty minutes, so why does my character have to use the bathroom five or more times a game? Why do the DIE if they don't make it to the bathroom in time?The whole ordeal reminds me too much of The Sims, where the needs of my character is a delicate system of checks and balances. Once one need is satisfied it throws all the other needs wildly out of order until the whole game devolves into a mad dash to get to the bathroom, then to eat, then to take a shower and so on and so forth until one can't help but completely forget that they were supposed to kill someone.

er 24, 2014
												A game which hinges on it's multiplayer community. It's basically the Assassin live-action game rule set. It's a silly game to have some fun with, but doesn't have a well balanced sense of play.Everyone is huntering another person on the ship, and your goal is to kill your target with the most valuable item at the time to earn the most cash before the round is over. If you die by another person hunting you, your hunt is over for that turn. But, if anyone else that kills you during that match, you can still hunt down your quarry.The game tries to discourage camping, but the negative effects doesn't rise fast enough before any single match is over to prevent camping a safe spot. Additionally, there isn't too much to discourage people from out right murdering everyone they see. If they are already behind in the game, the deduction on killing someone not as your quarry will remove some cash.If you're looking to have some laughs, this is a good game to grab and play with your friends. But you might struggle to find a sense of balanced play if anyone decides to play cheesy.

y 11, 2013
												The Ship is a take on a first person shooter. You can either become a spectator or a hunter. If you choose to become a spectator you get to board the ship as a spectator and you can interact with other players but you can not loot or kill people but can yourself be killed as an innocent bystander. If you however choose to become a hunter you also board the ship but you can loot people and containers in order to get weapons, once you have some weapons you will be given a target; who if you have identified you will have a picture of; you will also be given a location where they where last identified by someone. If you have not identified them yourselves you will only be given the rough location. Once you track down your target it is your job to kill them in the most unique way with the weapons not used in a while giving you more money then those used recently. To increase the difficulty you must also kill them whilst not in view of any cameras or staff and depending on the settings other people in general or you will be sent to the onboard prison. Finally you also have to interact like a standard human being ensuring that you eat, drink, sleep, entertain yourself aswell as using the bathroom for the toilet and for cleaning purposes. However the server list on steam is broken :( and you will have to look on the internet to find some of The Ship servers. I should also note that the graphics on this game serve it well but its not going to win any awards in anyones books. However this game is great fun and I would highly recommend it to people who want to have some fun.10/10

25, 2011
												THE SHIP – A TWISTED FPS SIMS GAME THAT YOU'RE NOT PLAYING.  The Ship is a game by Outerlight that is available on Steam.  It's a curious little game, a mixture of first person shooter, The Sims, and Clue.  However, instead of a mansion, you're on a cruise liner and instead of trying to solve a murder, you're trying to off your fellow passengers.  The premise of The Ship is that you're one of the hapless passengers stuck on a cruise liner, prisoner to the mysterious Mr. X.  In order to amuse him, the passengers are tasked with offing each other with weapons, both esoteric and mundane, located on the ship.  There are some rules:  Each passenger is assigned a particular target to kill and will get money based on the method of killing them.  Some weapons are worth more than others.  You get nothing if you kill someone you're not assigned.  Also, you must kill your quarry without being seen.  Guards and security cameras are positioned all over the ship.  Kill carefully!

ber 14, 2015
												Simplified Review: This game will break friendships 5x faster than Mario Kart, and that's not an easy accomplishment.Actual Review: The game is complex, unforgiving, and undying fun. You have to pay attention to everything and  never let your guard down, and if you do, you'll wish you didn't. You must hunt your quarry, before YOUR hunter hunts you. Search every container you can find, and if you see a weapon you fancy, grab it. But when you get that weapon, keep it holstered until you see your quarry. Security Guards and cameras are everywhere, and boy do they make you regret everything and let your rage out on chat (it happens sometimes, trust me). If you're smart enough to know all this, it pays off gloriously. The satisfaction you have when you kill your quarry is like the satisfaction when you pass a test, you think you can't do it, but then you work hard and finish well. Hopefully, you can be high on the leaderboard by following the normal procedures needed. The only problem I have encountered in this game is it's bugs and difficult multiplayer browser. Overall, the game is one of the lil' gems tucked in Steam's growing library. If you can get it on a sale.FINAL VERDICT: 8.5/10

												As of the 21st of December 2011 The Ship is back for sale under new owners (poor Outerlight) I must sincerly tell you people how fun this game was.The aim of the game is simple, kill your prey without getting killed by your hunter or spotted by the security of the ship and other passengers with a hilarious amount of weaponry and traps on board a series of art deco turn of the century era Ocean liners and other boats. You think this would be easy but there is catch. You have to eat, sleep, use the facilities and wash leaving you and your prey equally open to moments of bloody murder.The man or woman with the most amount of money for pulling off the perfect murder wins. This game has a cartoony-esqe class as charming as TF2 with gameplay fit to match please do buy it and gift a copy to a friend and give it another chance.

												This game is original, exciting and will probably never get old. And as a bonus on that they're planning on making a remastered verision of it, which you will get a 25 % off if you own this game in your steam library. About all these people talking about the dead servers that's not true. From what i've heard the in game browsing is broken so you have to find the servers another way. Go to the servers on the steam platform without having the game started and filter for the game there and you will see at least 10 servers to join, with a lot of private ones aswell.And no the developers aren't gone, the game just switched owners. And because of some weird legal stuff the new developers are not able to change anything in the current game, and that's why they're planning on making the remastered verision. The owners seem to be close to the players and are eager to answer questions and help the game(heard they even read all the reviews of the game so they could improve the new verision). So buy the game before it's too late, it's really fun :D

												Everything else is boring to you?Then play this, it's awkward and yet it's fun. The stalker simulator you've been waiting for.You can roleplay too!Here's what I did for lolz:- Sat on stairway with knife out, slicing passerby. People fled for their lives even though they weren't my targets.- Stalked random individuals, crouching, pretending I'm looking at others but following them, eventually they panic and the reactions are hilarious specially if their hunter kills them and you are not even involved.- Hunting, killing random ship mates is still a better love story than twilight.- Setting traps, and watching people try pick them up and go to space.- Stalking a person and pushing it into a room, then closing the door. They always panic and pull out a gun or melee weapon, all you have to do is run out (assuming you survive) and they'll get arrested, pull out a weapon and join them in jail then find a shank and stare at them for a while, pull out the shank and have fun.This game is surely best with friends. The only thing it lacks is direct and global voice chat which I hope new devs will implement. The server browser is cumbersome (read community hub) but it works.Worth a buy, specially on sale as the game drops cards which quickly redeem the game in worth anyway.

												Now that I've finally been able to play the game online with some friends, I've changed my opinion on the game. The concept of the game is really awesome. It has some issues here and there which I hope will be addressed in the new version, but overall, it's definitely a fun game... if you can get a game going (helps to have someone who knows what they're doing to host the server).The game is sure to create a huge amount of stress and frustrations, but it's also sure to cause a lot of laughture and priceless moments.Contains a bunch of gameplay issues which should not exist at all. Example: If you're in a small washroom stall and the door is closed, when you go to open the door again, you either need to be standing on top of the toilet or risk getting permanently wedged between the door and the wall since the door will not stop trying to open completely. Also, guns make melee weapons almost pointless. If they have guns and you only have a melee weapon, seriously, good luck with that.

												I've never read anything by Agatha Cristie but I've seen plenty of Poriot on Masterpiece Theater so I know what I'm talking about here: This is a pretty fun game but annoying. First of all, if I'm on a boat full of potential murderers the last thing I'm going to be doing is worrying about where I can get my hands on a bag of chips. Matches on average last about thirty minutes, so why does my character have to use the bathroom five or more times a game? Why do the DIE if they don't make it to the bathroom in time?The whole ordeal reminds me too much of The Sims, where the needs of my character is a delicate system of checks and balances. Once one need is satisfied it throws all the other needs wildly out of order until the whole game devolves into a mad dash to get to the bathroom, then to eat, then to take a shower and so on and so forth until one can't help but completely forget that they were supposed to kill someone.

4, 2015
												Really fun game with quite interesting mechanics. You are trapped on a Ship along with other Players, having to murder each other to win the competition. Each player is assigned to the other in a pair. A Hunter and the Hunted. A Hunter is trying to find and kill the Hunted one, while the Hunted one is most likely a Hunter to someone else and tries to find them and kill them.So basically you really need to watch your back, as anyone might try to plot to kill you, perhaps waiting for the moment when you go to sleep... Yes, sleep. In the game you have to sustain your character's needs via sleep, eating, drinking, talking and reading books/entertaining. Think of it as The Sims with a twisted plot where characters must kill each other off.Also... Killing people won't win you the game. Killing them in the most paying way will earn you the victory. Each kill is awarding amount of money based on the weapon you use to kill someone (unless you use environment, like the Freezer/Life-Boats.)Amazing game, fun to play 1v1, but it is recommended to play on the server with other players. You can also play alone against bots. They sometimes can surprise you, but most of the time they are slightly disappointing.10/10 - Recommended.

er 10, 2016
												The ship is a creative source engine take on a familiar concept (murder mystery party), and is just crazy enough to be a sucess. This game feels like "Team fortress", "Hitman 2", and "Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory" had a baby, and that baby really liked "Clue".(Screenshots here.)You will play as a passanger on a ship, or other enclosed map, and be assigned another player to assassinate. There will be a player trying to assassinate you at the same time, so you'll need to be watching your back, as well as hunting your target. You can search your enviornment for weapons, but be careful, because if you get caught with a weapon in your hand, or attacking someone in front of a witness, and you'll be thrown in the brig!The true fun in this game is in multiplayer, and the server finder is broken, so you'll need to find games through the Steam  interface, rather than in game. From the Steam app, look at the bar up top left of the screen and highlight "View" with your mouse. From there click "Servers", and filter by game to only show "The Ship". You should be able to join games from there.This game is not without it's flaws. The learning curb is steep, and it's not always clear when you can and can't get away with drawing a weapon without instantly being arrested.All in all, I'd say this game is worth the money, and is a lot of fun. I would reccomend spending the money on it if you find the premise interesting, and are willing to spend some time learning the game's quirks.

She stands at the sink and washes his hands, and you at this time going slowly to her and stabs in the back. Victim muffled screams and falls to the floor.
